info.title: Invokation API
info.description:
## Introduction
Welcome to the Invokation REST API.

Soon you too will wield the full power of our skill ratings and matchmaking systems.

## Authentication
The Invokation API uses API keys to authenticate requests. You can view and manage your API keys in the Invokation dashboard.

Your API keys carry many privileges, make sure to keep them secure!
Do not share your secret API keys in publicly accessible areas such as Github, client-side code and so forth.

All API requests must be made over [HTTPS](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_Secure). Calls made over plain HTTP will fail.
API requests without authentication will also fail.

## Compression

You can enable compression by including the `Accept-Encoding` header in your request.

We support the following compression algorithms: `zstd`, `br`, `gzip` or `deflate`.


## Support
If you need help, don't hesitate to reach out to us at support@invokation.games or join our [Community Discord](https://discord.gg/JfNGsunrjX).

get.description: Get the current active model configuration

parameters.name: model_id
parameters.description: ID of the skill rating model

401.description: Unauthorized to use this model. Missing API key.

403.description: Forbidden. This API key has no access to the specified model.

post.description: During or after the match, you can retrieve skill rating updates based on the provided player sessions.

parameters.name: model_id
parameters.description: ID of the skill rating model

401.description: Unauthorized to use this model. Missing API key.

403.description: Forbidden. This API key has no access to the specified model.

post.description: Useful to calculate the expected outcome.

parameters.name: model_id
parameters.description: ID of the skill rating model

401.description: Unauthorized to use this model. Missing API key.

403.description: Forbidden. This API key has no access to the specified model.

a.description: Alpha parameter of the Beta distribution

b.description: Beta parameter of the Beta distribution

details.description: Optional additional details about the error

max_ts.description: The maximum timestamp for the match

mean_mmr.description: The mean MMR of all players in the match

min_ts.description: The minimum timestamp for the match

mmr_deviation.description: MMR deviation for this match (useful to determine match quality)

party_count.description: Total parties that were part of this match

player_count.description: Total amount of unique players in this match

team_count.description: Total teams that were part of this match

season.description: The season the match was played in

match_end_ts.description: Time the match ended (ISO 8601 UTC timestamp). Apart from backfilling historical data or simulations, you probably don't need to pass this.

match_start_ts.description: Time the match started (ISO 8601 UTC timestamp). Apart from backfilling historical data or simulations, you probably don't need to pass this.

oneOf.description: Several properties to provide more context about the match

player_sessions.description: A list of all player sessions for one single match. There can be multiple sessions for the same player.

teams.description: A list of teams and their metadata

players.description: List of skill rating updates per player. One per player.

player_id.description: The unique identifier of the player (passed through)

post.description: Updated player stats after this match

prior.description: Player stats from the start of this match

adjusted_mmr.description:
Adjusted MMR that was used for matchmaking / team-balancing.
For example; players who are in a party will often perform better than their individual MMR would suggest
A matchmaker or teambalancer might take this into account by calculating a bonus to the MMR
However, such a bonus could cause a party to gain more or lose less MMR than they would otherwise
By providing this value, we can compensate for this effect.

bot_level.description:
If this is a bot, an optional bot skill level for analytics purposes
Default: null

is_bot.description: Used to flag this session as a Bot session

party_id.description:
Local identifier of the player's party.
If set, should be unique per party per match.
Default behavior is to treat each player as their own party, so party_id can be omitted for games that don't support parties.

perf_beta.description:
Override for rating uncertainty (advanced option)
Default behavior is to use values generated by model

player_id.description: The unique identifier of the player

player_score.description:
The player score in this match
Default: 0
It's up to the game to determine this value. The only requirement is that a higher score is better than a lower score.
This value only matters if player performance is configured to have non-zero weight.

player_score_start.description:
The player's score at the start of this session (advanced option)
Default behavior is to inherit player_score from the end of the previous session (recommended)
Used for score-per-minute normalization in cases where players can rejoin matches
e.g. set this to 0 if player scores are reset on rejoin

prior_games_played.description: The previous number of games the player has played (ever, or just this season).

prior_mmr.description:
The MMR of the player at the start of the match.
A number between 0 and 1
Default: default_mmr specified in the MMR configuration

prior_momentum.description:
Incoming momentum (**not used in most models**)
For models with experimental anti-smurfing features or rating acceleration
Essentially rolling-average win rate

team_id.description:
Local identifier of the player's team.
If set must match one of the teams provided in the MatchResult.
Default behavior is to treat each player as their own team, so team_id can be omitted for 1v1 or free-for-all modes.

end.description: A timestamp of when this playersession ended.

start.description: A timestamp of when this playersession started.

alpha.description:
Calculated scale factor for uncertainty and step sizes
typically = 1.0 outside of placement

is_final_placement.description: Was this the last match of placement

mmr_delta.description: Change in MMR after this match

placement_frac.description:
All the teams the player was a part of during this match
Fraction of placement completed (max of 1.0, but can be negative)

player_expected.description:
Expected individual outcome for the player (0-1)
potentially clamped to a maximum value (typically 0.8) to guarantee minimum payoffs

player_outcome.description: Actual individual outcome for the player (0-1)

player_weight.description: How much weight individual outcome has to influence MMR

residual.description: Difference between actual and expected outcomes (prediction error)

session_count.description: Total number of sessions for this player during this match

team_count.description: The amount of teams the player was a part of during this match

team_expected.description: Weighted average of expected outcomes of all teams this player was a member of

team_outcome.description: Weighted average of actual outcomes of all teams this player was a memeber of

team_weight.description: How much weight team outcome has to influences MMR

unified_expected.description: Combined team and individual expected outcomes

unified_expected_dist.description:
The Beta distribution of expected outcomes
Encodes how much certainty we have about the unified expected outcome

unified_outcome.description: Combined team and individual actual outcomes

mean_mmr.description: The mean MMR of all players in the match

mmr_deviation.description: MMR deviation for this match (useful to determine match quality)

party_count.description: Total parties that were part of this match

player_count.description: Total amount of unique players in this match

team_count.description: Total teams that were part of this match

player_id.description: The unique identifier of the player (passed through)

post.description: Updated player stats after this match

prior.description: Player stats from the start of this match

alpha.description:
Calculated scale factor for uncertainty and step sizes
Typically = 1.0 outside of placement

is_final_placement.description: Was this the last match of placement

mmr_delta.description: Expected change in MMR if match ends as predicted

placement_frac.description: Fraction of placement completed (max of 1.0, but can be negative)

player_expected.description:
Expected individual outcome for the player (0-1)
Potentially clamped to a maximum value (typically 0.8) to guarantee minimum payoffs

player_weight.description: How much weight individual outcome is expected to influence MMR

team_expected.description: Expected weighted average of outcomes for all teams this player is a member of

team_weight.description: How much weight team outcome is expected to influence MMR

unified_expected.description: Combined team and individual expected outcomes

unified_expected_dist.description:
The Beta distribution of expected outcomes
Encodes how much certainty we have about the unified expected outcome

adjusted_mmr.description:
Adjusted MMR that was used for matchmaking / team-balancing.
For example; players who are in a party will often perform better than their individual MMR would suggest
A matchmaker or teambalancer might take this into account by calculating a bonus to the MMR
However, such a bonus could cause a party to gain more or lose less MMR than they would otherwise
By providing this value, we can compensate for this effect.

bot_level.description:
If this is a bot, an optional bot skill level for analytics purposes
Default: null

is_bot.description: Used to flag this session as a Bot session

party_id.description:
Local identifier of the player's party
If set, should be unique per party per match
Default behavior is to treat each player as their own party, so party_id can be omitted for games that don't support parties.

perf_beta.description:
Override for rating uncertainty (advanced option)
Default behavior is to use values generated by model

player_id.description: The unique identifier of the player

prior_games_played.description: The previous number of games the player has played (ever, or just this season).

prior_mmr.description:
The MMR of the player at the start of the match.
A number between 0 and 1
Default: default_mmr specified in the MMR configuration

prior_momentum.description:
Incoming momentum (**not used in most models**)
For models with experimental anti-smurfing features or rating acceleration
Essentially rolling-average win rate

team_id.description:
Local identifier of the player's team
If set must match one of the teams provided in the MatchResult
Default behavior is to treat each player as their own team, so team_id can be omitted for 1v1 or free-for-all modes.

oneOf.description: Several properties to provide more context about the match

player_sessions.description: A list of all player sessions for one single match. There can be multiple sessions for a single player.

teams.description: A list of teams and their metadata

players.description: List of skill rating updates per player. One per player.

team_id.description: Unique identifier for the team (within the context of this match)

expected.description:
The expected team outcome based on party and team model (0-1)
Potentially clamped to a maximum value (typically 0.8) to guarantee minimum payoffs

id.description: The local identifier of the team (passthrough)

mmr.description: Total MMR of the team as determined by the party and team models (not necessarily the sum of MMRs)

size.description: Total player count the team has seen throughout the match

momentum.description: Rolling-average win rate (**if used by model**)

team_id.description: Unique identifier for the team (within the context of this match)

expected.description:
the expected team outcome based on party and team model (0-1)
potentially clamped to a maximum value (typically 0.8) to guarantee minimum payoffs

id.description: The local identifier of the team (passthrough)

mmr.description: Total MMR of the team as determined by the party and team models (not necessarily the sum of MMRs)

outcome.description:
the team outcome (0-1)
regardless of individual performance

size.description: Total player count the team has seen throughout the match

api_key.name: x-ivk-apikey
api_key.description: You can manage your API keys in the IVK portal.

tags.name: Skill
tags.description: IVK Skill provides skill rating algorithms and updates for multiplayer games.
